Executive Summary



A - Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

        

The Spoetzel Brewery, located in Shiner, Texas, is committed to protecting the public, its employees, and the environment from any accidental releases of hazardous materials used at its facilities.  We have implemented safety, environmental protection, and risk management programs to prevent hazardous materials releases.





B. Regulated Substances That We Use



Spoetzl Brewery, Inc. produces and bottles Shiner beer.  The ammonia refrigeration system is a utility system supporting the plant by providing space conditioning for beer/intermediates tank storage and various brewing process areas. The system also provides cooling to generate chilled water or glycol through flooded heat exchangers which, in turn, supplies secondary media and/or direct product cooling. 



We use and store quantities of Anhydrous Ammonia in excess of 10,000 pounds in our refrigeration system.  Industry has used Anhydrous Ammonia for many years as a coolant because it is widely available, relatively inexpensive, and has an exceptional ability to remove large quantities of heat.  It is designated as an Extremely Hazardous Substance by the Environmental Protection Agency.  However, if stored and handled properly, it is relatively safe to use as a refrigerant.



C.  Accidental Release Prevention Program



Spoetzl Brewery has adopted a program to meet the requirements of both the the Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management standard (PSM) and EPA.  Spoetzl Brewery maintains a release prevention program with the primary focus of protecting the public and plant employees from the hazards associated with an accident or release involving anhydrous ammonia.  



The multi-faceted program includes:



* The use of Process Safety Information to document safe process design

* Operating Procedures to ensure that the system is operated safely

* Maintenance, inspection and testing of all

ammonia refrigeration equipment and piping to ensure that the system is maintained according to applicable standards and manufacturer's recommendations

* The Employee Participation Program and training to ensure that all employees and contractors working on and around the processes are aware of the hazards, can perform their job duties correctly and safely

* Procedures for Hot Work, Confined Space Entry, line breaks and other potentially hazardous processes and training in those procedures so that job duties can be performed safely; 

* Contractor Safety Program to ensure that all contractors performing work for Spoetzl Brewery, Inc. are qualified to perform job duties correctly and safely 

* Management of Change and Pre-startup Safety Reviews to ensure that changes are documented, analyzed and kept within the design basis;  *Incident Investigation procedures that provide method to investigate each incident, including "near misses" to determine root causes and make needed safety improvements.



The program also provides for the required Process Hazard Analyses to evaluate the chemical and process hazards and to determine safeguards that could be added;  Compliance Audits to ensure that Process Safety Management requirements are met or exceeded and to address findings promptly; Mechanical Integrity inspections to determine condition of process equipment so that deficiencies can be identified and corrected.



D.  Five Year Accident History



Within the past five years, Spoetzl Brewery, Inc., has not had any accidental releases that resulted in injuries or property damage or negative environmental impact.  The plant has maintained an excellent safety record throughout its operating history with no major anhydrous ammonia releases that could have had adverse effects on the employees, the public, property, or the environment



E.  Emergency Response Plan



If there is an accidental release, the Spoetzl Brewery has an emergency response program that coordinates em

ergency response with the Shiner Fire Department.  If such a release did occur, designated member(s) of the Emergency Response team contacts the Shiner Fire Department. In addition, Spoetzl will contact their emergency response firm, SWS Environmental Services, Cibolo, Texas who will respond in the event of a release with trained personnel.  



Our Emergency Action Plan has been revised extensively to ensure that response to any emergency is swift and effective.  It addresses measures to protect the lives of employees, contractors, visitors and tourists at the facility.    Training is provided regarding the Emergency Response Plan.



F. Planned changes to improve safety



Spoetzl Brewery, Inc., continues to strengthen its safety program and continually works to effectively manage the hazards of anhydrous ammonia to protect the community we serve and our employees.  Training is in the forefront of process safety management.  



Safety in all aspects of Spoetzl Brewery, Inc., operations is part of our culture.  With the planned expansion of the facility, the issue of safety retains top priority.  We continue to improve processes and work practices and to enhance the ability of our personnel to assure safe and efficient control and management and operation of our plant.
